title: IRSA releases 426,671 cusecs water
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 11 (APP):Indus River System Authority (IRSA) on Friday released 426,671 cusecs water from various rim stations with inflow of 455,737 cusecs.
According to the data released by IRSA, the water level in River Indus at Tarbela Dam was 1523.52 feet which was 121.52 feet higher than the dead level of 1402.00 feet. Water inflow and outflow in the dam was recorded as 309,100 cusecs and 296,800 cusecs, respectively.
The water level in River Jhelum at Mangla Dam was 1183.20 feet, which was 133.20 feet higher than its dead level of 1,050 feet. The inflow and outflow of water was recorded 24,766 cusecs and 8,000 cusecs, respectively.
The release of water at Kalabagh, Taunsa, Guddu and Sukkur was recorded as 349,676, 354,685, 229,446 and 118,050 cusecs, respectively. Similarly, from River Kabul, a total of 55,800 cusecs of water released at Nowshera and 39,281 cusecs released from River Chenab at Marala.
